person.persName: Benjamin Franklin Bradley (Kentucky attorney, CSA Rep Congress, major 1st Battalion Ky Mtd Riflemen)

body.p: Kentucky attorney, soldier, and politician. Married to Emily Mary Sanders Bradley. Father of Anna Bradley, Mathew S. Bradley, Victor F. Bradley, Betty Sanders Bradley, and John Bradley. Educated at Georgetown College and graduated from the law department of Transylvania University in 1846. Admitted to the bar and practiced law in Georgetown, Kentucky, and Chicago, Illinois. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteers as a regimental adjutant and brigade adjutant in the U.S.-Mexican War. Moved to Chicago to practice law and work as a land agent from 1854 to 1861. Served in the First Battalion of Kentucky Mounted Riflemen as a major (C.S.A.) from 1861 to 1864. Represented the 11th Congressional District in the House of Representatives of the Second Confederate Congress from 1864 to 1865.
